com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget
Class WPProgressBar

java.lang.Object
  View
      com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget.WPProgressBar

public class WPProgressBar
extends View

Custom progress bar that utilizes the default accent color and a number of animated dots (or a moving bar in the case of non-indeterminate progress) to represent a loading operation in an application. Its features are customizable including color, mode, etc. It currently uses its own dimensions to animate itself.

Since:
03-16-2012

getColor

public int getColor()
Returns:
The current color to be displayed as the animating dot/ line based on which mode is utilized.

isIndeterminate

public boolean isIndeterminate()
Returns:
True if this is an indeterminate progess bar, or one without a definite min/ max but a continuous progress animation.

setIndeterminate

public void setIndeterminate(boolean i)
Set whether or not to make this progress bar indeterminate, or without regard to a min/ max percentage scale but rather continuous.

getNumberOfDots

public int getNumberOfDots()
Returns:
The number of dots to display at a given moment based on the current coordinates/ animation progress.
